entry.string: Adminpanels is a Xaraya Core Module responsible for the display of the Administration Menu.
Configuration and display of the Administration menu
Global switch for display of all module Overviews
Global switch for the Admin Dashboard backend theme use
Display of information about content awaiting approval

When you login as a website administrator, you should see the default Admin Menu, which lists installed and activated modules. These are the modules with administrative functions and a user interface (UI). They allow you to set various parameters, which change the layout or behaviour of either the module itself or the web site.
in the Adminpanels menu currently has three options:
Admin Menu sort modules by Category or Name - global switch, can be overridden in individual instances of the Adminpanels Admin Menu block
Disable Module Overviews - This switch turns off display by default of all module Overviews, such as the one you are reading now.

Enable Admin Dashboard - This switch turns on the Admin Dashboard, a special theme reserved only for Site Administrators. By Default it displays as a horizontal drop down menu with all active modules with an Admin UI listed.

An Adminpanels Adminmenu block can be configured in a number of ways. After creating the Adminmenu block instance you have the option of overriding the default sort order and selecting sort by category or name. You can position the Adminmenu in any of the default blockgroups shipped in Xaraya such as left, or right. Alternatively create your own blockgroup and add your Adminmenu block to it in the usual way (See the documentation on Blocks for more information). You can also display an Admin logout link in the menu by checking the relevant option.

The block will display content waiting on approval for any modules that supply a hook for waiting content (eg Articles Module). To use it, create a Content Waiting block and then hook the Module supplying the hook to Adminpanels. For example, to display waiting content in Articles module, go to
Then make your way to Adminpanels checkbox and check it to display any articles waiting approval in your Content Waiting block.
Adminpanels has no hooks included at this time.
entry.translation: Beheerderpanelen heeft op dit moment geen hooks meegekregen.
